A trained covered x km at 40 kmph and another 2x km at 20 kmph. Find the average speed of the train in covering the entire 3x km.
Solution: x/40 + 2x/20 hours  = 5x/40 = x/8 hours   :::   Average speed = 3x/(x/8) = 24 kmph

. Excluding stoppages, the speed of a bus is 54 km/hr and including stoppages, it is 45 km/hr. For how many minutes does the bus stop per hour?
Solution: Time taken to cover 9 km = 9/54 * 60 = 10 min.

Running at a speed of 60km/h a train passed through a 1.5 km long tunnel in 2 min. What is the length of the train?
Solution: 60 km/h = 60 x 1000 = 60000m/h  = 2min = (1/30)  :::  hence the length of the train =500m
